topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5516e85363687277324f0400#post_5516e85363687277324f0400
[bq="Thanotos Omega"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5516e73863687277d4c70400#post_5516e73863687277d4c70400
I am a guy who believes that everyone deserves all the same advantages i was born with, I want nothing more and nothing less, [/bq]
Don't take this the wrong way but as someone that was born with nothing to the point that I grew up dumpster diving occasionally how 90% of people nowadays calling for "equality" don't understand jack shit about how to make the world a better place and seems more along the lines of a group of people who feel bad about being privilege so they try to make the world better but because they've never been in that situation they don't understand how to make the world better and are therefore ineffective at it.


People born into wealth for the most part are extremely ineffective at it, know they are ineffective at it and therefore seem to be extremely angry people angry at the world cause while they are good hearted they don't understand the problems in the world cause they've never experienced it.



To put it another way: as a straight white guy have you ever as a teenager have to constantly live in fear of being thrown out, have to live in fear of having to go dumpster diving or such?  Have you ever gone dumpster diving?  Have you ever had to wear clothes that were in the trash?  Have you ever had to live in a shelter?

To expand further on this does this realization that you haven't experienced a situation like that internally make you angry at yourself for lacking experience into such a situation because you want to help make things better for people but cause you haven't experienced that situation you don't understand how to improve things for people in those situations and therefore you get angry at yourself and others?


While I'm vehemently opposed to such groups here's my personal advice to people cause a lot of people in your situation don't understand the situation; if you want to make the world a better place here's some small things to help:
Donate canned food to shelters.
Donate clothing.
Donate shampoo and soap.
Donate blankets.... no seriously as someone that has been in a shelter before this is often needed.
Donate laundry soap for clothes.
Donate old stuff that is functional but you don't use and were about to throw out.  A tv may not be necessary, but having a tv to watch a movie after watching your mom get the shit beat out of her and you both thrown on the street is a island of mental stability and a absolute godsend.  Hell you could donate old books and it could help emotionally.



Here's the options:
A)You donate clothing that you don't use any more thus helping the person look more professional when job searching and potentially you directly get them a job/you donate food/you donate blankets/etc
B)You just want to complain on the internet instead of actually put some effort into it.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: Also I would want to point out that 40% of homeless teens are glbt and that veterans are homeless at a rate of 20 times higher than non-veterans.  If you want to support glbt or veterans then donate to your local shelter cause I'm pretty sure donating old clothing isn't that much of a hassle.
